page.title: 13Sanctuary at Kimpton
page.content: {Cats:}Those that we saw in the Blue Cross Home at Kimpton were very playful and the kittens were sharing a compartment with some rabbits. There was another section for the fully grown cats and they were just lazing about. {Horses:}Ponies and horses that have become too old for a working life may be brought to Kimpton to finish their days as "pensioners". Ill treated horses are sometimes brought in and in that case may be allowed out to other homes on loan. At present there are 3 horses, 2 ponies,and 2 donkeys in the field; with a stable to use if they wish. {Any others:}There are also rabbits that live in the same block as the cats. In the past the home has housed guinea pigs, hamsters and even pet mice.
